root.name: Boolean

example.code: a = False if not a: rect(30, 20, 50, 50) a = True if a: line(20, 10, 90, 80) line(20, 80, 90, 10)

root.description: Datatype for the Boolean values True and False. It is common to use boolean values with control statements to determine the flow of a program. The first time a variable is written, it must be declared with a statement expressing its datatype.
